# Music Entity: Arpeggio - Major 7th in D (Shape: G)

## Description
An arpeggio is the playing of the tones of a chord in succession rather than simultaneously. The Major 7th arpeggio in D utilizing the G shape consists of the D, F#, A, and C# notes.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (Root)
- F# (Major 3rd)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- C# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz and fusion genres to add a lush, sophisticated feel to the music. The Major 7th quality gives a sense of tension and resolution, creating a smooth and colorful sound that can evoke feelings of nostalgia or contemplation.

## Songs Using this Arpeggio
1. Song: "Blue Bossa" by Kenny Dorham
2. Song: "So What" by Miles Davis
3. Song: "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
